rows.label: kizunatalk004_msg0001
rows.name:
My Lady... Over there.
The capital's standing army.

rows.label: kizunatalk004_msg0002
rows.name: I can see them.

rows.label: kizunatalk004_msg0003
rows.name:
It brings back bitter memories, 
so I'd rather not get close.

rows.label: kizunatalk004_msg0004
rows.name: Well, yeah...

rows.label: kizunatalk004_msg0005
rows.name: Please rest assured.

rows.label: kizunatalk004_msg0006
rows.name:
The ones who captured us were also 
from the Superbian army, but they 
were from the Gula regional forces.

rows.label: kizunatalk004_msg0007
rows.name: They're different?

rows.label: kizunatalk004_msg0008
rows.name: Quite different, in fact.

rows.label: kizunatalk004_msg0009
rows.name:
I learned various things in the 
prison, so I've built up quite 
a knowledge of the imperial forces.

rows.label: kizunatalk004_msg0010
rows.name:
In my solitary cell, 
I couldn't talk to anyone though.

rows.label: kizunatalk004_msg0011
rows.name:
It seems Drivers and Blades were 
treated differently, as expected.

rows.label: kizunatalk004_msg0012
rows.name:
When I grew tired of planning my escape,
I would listen to the conversations 
of prisoners and soldiers.

rows.label: kizunatalk004_msg0013
rows.name: Did you hear anything else?

rows.label: kizunatalk004_msg0014
rows.name: Let me think...

rows.label: kizunatalk004_msg0015
rows.name:
As I mentioned earlier, 
those soldiers over there are 
from the capital's standing army...

rows.label: kizunatalk004_msg0016
rows.name:
While those soldiers over 
there are from the First Imperial 
Guard's 2nd Battalion.

rows.label: kizunatalk004_msg0017
rows.name: Eh? They're not the same?

rows.label: kizunatalk004_msg0018
rows.name:
Beyond that bridge is Hadashal Palace. 
In other words...

rows.label: kizunatalk004_msg0019
rows.name:
I see! They belong to different units 
because they're protecting the palace.

rows.label: kizunatalk004_msg0020
rows.name:
Yes, and above the First Imperial 
Guard is the Cretas Guard...

rows.label: kizunatalk004_msg0021
rows.name:
And even above that is 
the Special Inquisitor... 
His Excellency the Flamebringer.

rows.label: kizunatalk004_msg0022
rows.name: Hmm...

rows.label: kizunatalk004_msg0023
rows.name:
Armies with their affiliations 
and ranks seem like a real hassle.

rows.label: kizunatalk004_msg0024
rows.name:
I imagine conflicts and 
rivalries happen frequently.

rows.label: kizunatalk004_msg0025
rows.name: What else should I ask?

rows.label: kizunatalk004_msg0026
rows.name: Nia, how was it in Iira?

rows.label: kizunatalk004_msg0027
rows.name: Got any other good ones, Byakko?

rows.label: kizunatalk004_msg0101
rows.name:
Iira... 
Shin was at the center of it all, 
but there weren't really any ranks.

rows.label: kizunatalk004_msg0102
rows.name:
We did have something 
like role assignments though.

rows.label: kizunatalk004_msg0103
rows.name: What did you do, Nia?

rows.label: kizunatalk004_msg0104
rows.name: I was...

rows.label: kizunatalk004_msg0105
rows.name: The nap specialist?

rows.label: kizunatalk004_msg0106
rows.name: No! General chores, general chores!

rows.label: kizunatalk004_msg0107
rows.name:
I hadn't been there long, 
so I was just helping everyone out.

rows.label: kizunatalk004_msg0108
rows.name:
I see. So not much different 
from now, huh?

rows.label: kizunatalk004_msg0109
rows.name: It is as you say.

rows.label: kizunatalk004_msg0110
rows.name:
Don't make it sound like 
I can't do anything!

rows.label: kizunatalk004_msg0111
rows.name:
I mean, I can make ruska dango
and stuff, so...

rows.label: kizunatalk004_msg0112
rows.name: Then, shall we cook together sometime?

rows.label: kizunatalk004_msg0113
rows.name: Yeah... Sounds good!

rows.label: kizunatalk004_msg0114
rows.name: My Lady, are you sure that's...

rows.label: kizunatalk004_msg0115
rows.name:
Next time, I'll make sure Rex 
and Byakko eat their fill!

rows.label: kizunatalk004_msg0116
rows.name: *sigh*...

rows.label: kizunatalk004_msg0117
rows.name:
You had best steel yourself,
Rex-sama.

rows.label: kizunatalk004_msg0118
rows.name: My Lady's cooking is truly not delicious...

rows.label: kizunatalk004_msg0119
rows.name: Ugh... Maybe I shouldn't have provoked her...

rows.label: kizunatalk004_msg0201
rows.name:
The smallest organizational unit 
in the Superbian army is apparently 
called a "ten-man squad."

rows.label: kizunatalk004_msg0202
rows.name:
It consists of a squad leader, 
a deputy, and 8 regular soldiers.

rows.label: kizunatalk004_msg0203
rows.name:
And it seems that 6 to 10 of 
these ten-man squads form what 
they call a "hundred-man unit."

rows.label: kizunatalk004_msg0204
rows.name: But eight is the usual number.

rows.label: kizunatalk004_msg0205
rows.name: I see...

rows.label: kizunatalk004_msg0207
rows.name:
...Rex-sama, didn't you ask me 
to tell you an interesting story?

rows.label: kizunatalk004_msg0208
rows.name: I did.

rows.label: kizunatalk004_msg0209
rows.name: Wasn't it interesting?

rows.label: kizunatalk004_msg0210
rows.name: Uh, which part?

rows.label: kizunatalk004_msg0211
rows.name:
The interesting part is that basically
when 8 ten-man squads come together, 
it's 80, but they call it 100-man unit.

rows.label: kizunatalk004_msg0212
rows.name: Ohhhh, now I get it...

rows.label: kizunatalk004_msg0213
rows.name:
Rex... This is the best he can do, 
so please be kind.

rows.label: kizunatalk004_msg0214
rows.name:
No, it was plenty interesting! 
Yeah, yeah.

rows.label: kizunatalk004_msg0215
rows.name: Do you really think so?
